Line: Hey, Lily, can you toss me a beer?

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Sure, honey. (She throws the key toward the wall besides Marshall)

Speaker: Ted:
Line: You have terrible aim.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: That's not true.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Lily, at our apartment, you're the one who pees on the floor.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Oh, my God. Barney's dad.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Hey, uh, you're Barney's friends, right?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Yeah, but... aren't you supposed to be off managing some tour in Australia?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: What? No, I... I'm a driving instructor up in White Plains. And I need your help... Barney won't return my calls.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: What do you mean, Barney won't return your calls? He said you two had an amazing night together.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: That's not what happened.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I'm not sure how to start this.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Yeah.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I think I need a drink.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Me, too.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Glen McKenna, neat.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Milk, skim.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Milk? Oh, you're taking it easy. Crazy night?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I'll say. Between you and me, I had a lot of acid last night.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Wow.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I think it was the chili dog. I had to take four Tums. I was up till, like, 9:30.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Hey, um.. When I was a kid, you used to be a roadie. You still do that?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: No. I switched lanes years ago. I should explain. I'm a driving instructor. Now you get it, right

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Yeah, no, I get it. Um, but when I was a kid, you... you were this total badass.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Oh, I know. I was a real hard partier.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Yeah, okay, now we're getting to the good stuff.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: The drugs, the alcohol, the women...

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Yes, yes, yes.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I was out of control.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: *Out of control.*

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: So when your mom said I couldn't see you any more, it was rock bottom for me. I'm so sorry.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: You ever bang Stevie Nicks?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Barney wasn't interested in my apology. He just wanted me to be cool. And I was so desperate to connect with him. I did something I'm not proud of. I started bragging.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I bet you didn't know this about me, Barney, but I've published two nonfiction books about asparagus. And one fiction. I'm credited with inventing the word "furgling." It means fumbling for keys. So then all the county fair judges started chanting, "More quiche! More quiche!" I guess you could call me the LeBron James of drapes.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I could tell he just wanted me to be this big ladies' man, so...

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: What a hottie, huh? I'm sure you're a real player.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Big-time.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Observe. Excuse me, that's my son over there. I'm trying to reconnect with him after 30 years. Would you just write down any seven numbers here, so that I can impress him? Please, I'm desperate.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Oh, my God, you're a natural. Think of the pickup plays we can run as a father-son duo. There's the "Father Knows Breast," there's the "Bush Dynasty," the "Lick Father, Lick Son."

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Oh, no, no. I couldn't do that.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Why?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I have a family now. That's my wife Cheryl, my daughter Carly... she's in college. This is my son J.J. I was hoping you could come over to dinner sometime and meet them.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: You're all wearing matching sweaters. That's cute. Look, I got to get going, Jerry. But, uh, this was great. Glad we did this.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I made him wait all these years for me and... I'm just not the guy he wanted me to be. I know I don't deserve it, but... I need another chance to connect with my son.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: We think you should give him another chance. That's the real reason we're out here. He lives ten minutes away.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: What?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: You're having dinner with him tonight.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: No, I most certainly am not. Look, I met him. He's not my kind of bro and that's that.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Are you sure it's not more than that?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Guys, get it through your heads. I am never gonna talk to my dad again.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: No, Barney. I'm never gonna talk to my dad again. But your dad is alive and he lives just down the road.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Fine, I'll go.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Awesome. Um, Lily, keys. (She throws them way too hard, they land in the trees) I'm literally 11 inches from you.

Speaker: Ted from 2030:
Line: And so Barney agreed to give his dad one more chance.

Speaker: Cherryl:
Line: Hello. You must be Barney. I'm Cheryl. It's just so nice to finally meet you. I love that suit.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Oh, thank you very much. And I love your...coat. I love your coat.

Speaker: Cherryl:
Line: Oh, that's your coat, Barney. I just took it from you.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Well, I do love it. It's doing a nice job covering up that chair.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Guess now we wait.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Hey, I got an idea how to pass the time. A little trivia game. Robin, reindeer: real or fake?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Okay, I'm not an idiot. Reindeer are obviously f... re... fake?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Yikes! I'm surrounded by a bunch of dum-dums. Good thing I don't have any gaps in my knowledge. I am perfect. Oh, for the love of God, guys, enough already.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: What, baby?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: You've been treating me with kid gloves ever since my dad died.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: That's not true.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Robin, don't disagree with Marshall.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: I'm sorry.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: I first noticed it at the bar.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Hey, Lily, (his voice cracks) Can you get me a mojito? Normally, you would've given me crap for an hour about a voice crack that pubescently girl-like, but nothing. So then I started to test you guys. [...] The Phantom Menace is by far the best Star Wars movie.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: It ages well, that's the thing.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: You guys like my new soul patch?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Righteous hair tab, brotha.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: And once I figured it out, I started doing crazy stuff to see how far you'd let me go. [...]Hey, guys. This is Rex. He's a possum. I found him in the trash. He lives with us now.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: I love him.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Lily, we are living with a possum. Rex is violent and he hates us.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: But, baby, you just lost your dad. None of us wants to upset you.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Please. If you guys really want me to get over the worst tragedy of my life, I'm begging you, tear me a new one. But not like Rex tried to in my sleep last night.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: J.J., dinner. When I got your letter, I dug this up. You were probably too young to remember, but this is you, this is me, and, of course, ZZ Top.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I do remember that. I climbed up on that dude's lap and told him what I wanted for Christmas.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Yeah, I used to love taking you backstage. You were the coolest little kid.

Speaker: JJ:
Line: Hi, Barney. It's great to finally meet you.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: J.J., I'm talking to Dad right now. God.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Seriously, it's time. What are my gaps?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Well, I guess maybe one gap you have is... you can't wink.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Don't you think that maybe we should go home and, uh, "do the laundry"

Speaker: Lily:
Line: You can't swallow pills.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Ooh, ooh, I got one. You think John Kennedy and Jack Kennedy are the same person. (laughs) Right? What?

Speaker: Cherryl:
Line: So, Barney, I understand you have a pretty big job with a bank.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Yeah, I do. I make a ton of money. How much do you make, J.J.?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Oh, well, huh, now we all know you make excuses. I was talking about money.

Speaker: Cherryl:
Line: Actually, J.J. has a job. Tell him, J.J.

Speaker: JJ:
Line: I got a paper route.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Good time to get into print media. Am I right, Dad?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Good slam, Barney.

Speaker: Cherryl:
Line: Jerry.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: It's all good fun. Just ribbing among long lost brothers.

Speaker: Cherryl:
Line: J.J.'s a heck of a basketball player.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Uh, you don't strike me as the athletic type, Jayj. Dad, check it. Triceps. What gym do you go to?

Speaker: JJ:
Line: Fourth period?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Sounds like you're having your fourth period. Am I right, Dad?!

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Got him again.

Speaker: Cherryl:
Line: Jerry!

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Oh, okay, Barney. Uh, maybe that's enough.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Why? J.J. started it. What does J.J. even stand for anyway? J... Jerky... Jerkface?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: J.J. stands for Jerome Jr.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Jerome Jr...? Oh. He's... he's named after you. Excuse me.

Speaker: JJ:
Line: I like having a brother.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: You always add too much water to oatmeal.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Yes, I drown the son of a bitch.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: You consistently miss at least one belt loop.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: It's like I'm blind.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: You're too old to ask to see the cockpit.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Whoa. Whoa. Guys, my dad just died.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Aw, honey.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: No, I'm just kidding. This is great. I really, I really missed this.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Barney, what is going on?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: This is mine.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I don't understand.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: J.J. gets a childhood, a dad, a real family and a basketball hoop? No, no. I at least get the hoop. I'm taking it with me.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Please, just come down and talk to me.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Why? Why should I? You're lame, okay? You're just some lame suburban dad.

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Why does that make you so mad?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Because if you were gonna be some lame suburban dad, why couldn't you have been that for me?!

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Look, Barney, I know I screwed up...

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Oh, "screwed up" doesn't even begin to describe...

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: I know, I know, I know! I want to fix this, and I don't know how! Please, tell me what I can do! I'll do anything! You're never gonna get it down like that. Barney. Barney! Just put the pointy end into the grooves. That's it. Now turn it. Righty tighty, lefty loosey. I have no good excuse, Barney. It took me years before I was even able to look myself in the mirror for the way I let you down. It took courage to send me that letter. More courage than I've ever had. I owe you a lifetime of apologies, and I... I just have no idea where to begin.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Can you help me with this?

Speaker: Jerry:
Line: Here, got it. Look, if you... ever feel like you're ready, I'd love nothing more than to be a part of your life.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Bye.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Are you sure you don't want to talk about it?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I'm fine. Hey, Ted.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Yeah, buddy.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: You, uh, still want a basketball hoop out there?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Oh, well, I also really liked your outdoor stripper pole idea. Yeah, it's fine.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: No, you were right. A kid needs a hoop.

Speaker: Ted from 2030:
Line: Kids, in the spring of 2011, Zoey and I broke up. But the good news: Goliath National Bank was finally ready to demolish The Arcadian and build the new headquarters I'd designed for them. (A committee, including Ted holding a big pair of scissors, is standing behind a red ruban. Ted is going to cut it, when a very happy Barney arrives with a bigger pair of scissors and cut the ruban before Ted can) The only problem was... I kept butting heads with my project supervisor on one very important issue.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: I want to press the button to blow up The Arcadian!

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I want to press it!

Speaker: Ted:
Line: I want to press it!

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I want to press it!

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Guys, I dated you both, and neither of you is good at pressing or even finding the button. After some awkward pawing around, that building's going to fake an implosion, say, "Baby, that was great"" and go to sleep.

Speaker: Both Ted and Barney, at the same time:
Line: She means you. I want to press it! I'm gonna press it!

Speaker: Robin:
Line: It's just a button, okay? Can we just talk about something else, please?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Well, I ran into Zoey yesterday.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: That's the first time since the breakup. How's she doing?

Speaker: Zoey:
Line: I'm still unemployed, so I had to get a couple roommates.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Saving money. Making new friends. No downside.

Speaker: Zoey:
Line: They're all 22 and sell drugs. Which means they're not taking them. So, that's a win.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Well, I can tell you're really busy so I should... I'll let you go.

Speaker: Zoey:
Line: Hey. You want to get coffee sometime?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: You know that "coffee" is code for "I want to get back together" right?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Well, at first I wasn't sure, but then she said something that got me thinking.

Speaker: Zoey:
Line: I want to get back together.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Don't worry, we're not. I just, I feel bad Zoey's having such a hard time.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: You know what might... make you feel better, buddy?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: I'm not letting you press the button.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I want to press the button!

Speaker: Ted:
Line: You're not pressing the button! It's my button!

Speaker: Ted from 2030:
Line: Sadly, that's all you need to know about my summer. Now, around this time, Uncle Marshall was still having a tough time finding a job.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: He's out printing out a whole new batch of rsums because he misspelled the phrase "detail-oriented." And when he gets back home, he is going to find his favorite soup there waiting for him.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Oh, that's sweet, Lil, but didn't you guys get food poisoning here one time?

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Three times. But they're really nice about it. Their policy is, "Get sick, get a free gallon of soup".

Speaker: Ted from 2030:
Line: And so, Lily dropped off Marshall's surprise soup and headed back to work to introduce the new class pet.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: This is Mr. Buttons 2. Now, after what happened to Mr. Buttons 1, we have to be very gentle with... (Lily throws up onto Mr. Buttons 2. She leaves the shool, running to her apartment in order to stop Marshall from eating the soup) Marshall! Don't eat the soup! Oh, thank God.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: This was about to be my third bowl. Why shouldn't I eat the soup? Why shouldn't I eat the soup?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Hey, Mr. Architect, big day for you tomorrow, huh?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Yeah. Getting to stand next to me while I press the button. That is going to be legend... wait for it...dary adjacent. Legendary adjacent!

Speaker: Robin:
Line: You okay?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Yeah... no. This morning I was talking to the foreman.

Speaker: Foreman:
Line: Hey, hotshot.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: You know, Rod, um, I'm loving that nickname, and I can tell it's totally affectionate, but, uh, I'd prefer Ted.

Speaker: Rod:
Line: Yeah, but you're such a hotshot, I figured I'd just call you hotshot. Pick one. And make sure you like it. There's going to be 50,000 of these in your big, hotshot building, hotshot.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: 50,000 lightbulbs! What if this one's too bright? What if this one flickers and gives everyone a weird headache? Do you know how many people it takes to change 50,000 lightbulbs?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Are these people Irish, Polish, blondes... what are we dealing with here?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: There's just-- there's so many decisions to be made. What if I make all the wrong ones and my building just sucks?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Not possible. Your building is new. And I have one rule: New is always better.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: You can't keep saying you have one rule if they're always different rules.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Ah, but "new is always better" is my oldest rule, which makes it the best.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Hi, Marsh.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Oh, hey, buddy.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Hey. Everything okay?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Lily got food poisoning from some soup. And then I ate the soup exactly three hours later. Which means I can see exactly three hours into my future, and it... doesn't... look... good. I tried to be supportive.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Oh, baby, can you just hold me, please?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Of course, baby. (He hesitates, then put one finger onto her back)

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: But it doesn't help it that when Lily gets going; she sounds like a velociraptor from Jurassic Park. But then I realized a man can do a lot of living in three hours. So, I'm out experiencing this beautiful, crazy dance called life. Ah, my last meal. MacClaren's famous jalapeno poppers. My doctor says I need to eat healthier, so I figured the round-trip flight these babies are about to take will land them permanently on the no-fry list. Good-bye, my friend. It's been a hell of a ride. I have to...

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Hey, babe. The gang says feel better.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Mm. Thanks. Wait, you didn't tell them I had food poisoning, did you?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Um, I...

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Marshall, when it's stomach stuff, you just say "under the weather," or people start picturing you doing unspeakable things.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: I know. I just said that you had the sniffles. No one is picturing anything but little red-nosed you under a blankie with some hot tea.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I wonder what end it's coming out of Lily right now.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: I bet it's her tushie.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I bet it's both. Hey, speaking of explosions... enough already, Ted! That button's mine!

Speaker: Ted, while texting on his phone:
Line: Yeah, fine, okay.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I got you this job, so I... Say what?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Whatever. It's yours. I gotta run. (Ted leaves the Bar)

Speaker: Barney:
Line: You...

Speaker: Marshall, picking up his phone:
Line: Hello?... Yes, it is. (To Lily) It's Bloom, Greenberg and Associates. They want me to come interview. (Lily throws up) I know it's risky to go, but this is the best environmental law firm in New York. It's my dream job. (Lily throws up) That's a great idea, babe. I'll ask them. (In his phone) Hey, is it at all possible, could I come in on Monday?... Okay, I'll, I'll see you at 5:00. (Marshall hangs up) Thank you. I love and believe in you, too, baby.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Why would Ted just give up the button like that? And he forgot his phone. "See you in an hour."

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Who's that from?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Zoey. They're meeting for coffee. Ted's getting back together with her!

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Why would Ted get back together with Zoey? He's doing great.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: After a breakup, we all think we're doing great. Sometimes the tiniest trigger can unravel you and send you crawling right back.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: No, I refuse to believe that Ted is getting back with Zoey because of lightbulbs.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Uh, Ted's gone back for less.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Hi, Natalie. You want to get coffee sometime?

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Bro.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Ted, I only have one rule.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: But I can't reach the worst part. (He picks his phone and calls someone) Hi, Karen. Want to get coffee sometime?

Speaker: announcer:
Line: Coming up next, our two local pandas, Ming Ming and Bao Bao, are expecting a baby.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Robin, you want to get coffee sometime...?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Get it together, bro.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: According to my calculations, at 6:00 p.m., my body is gonna pay out like the most disgusting slot machine in the world. That gives me two hours to go do the interview and still get back in time.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Oh, but, baby, what if you hit the jackpot early?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Don't worry. I'll be prepared.

Speaker: Neighbor:
Line: I'm talking your ear off, sorry. Is there anything I can do for you, sweetie?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Can... I... borrow... an adult diaper?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: We've got to stop Ted. Where are they meeting?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Okay, Zoey wrote, "Meet me at 6:00, where it all began, where you gave me the orchid at the intersection."

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Well, that's good. All we have to do is think back to the time Ted told us about his first date with Zoey.

Speaker: Ted:
Line: Amazing first date with Zoey! We met at the intersection... (The rest is unintelligible)

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Aw, that's sweet.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: You weren't listening either?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: I was in a coma. I mean, who pays attention to that sappy romantic crap?

Speaker: Barney and Robin:
Line: Lily!

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Yeah, I wasn't listening, either. Ted really can go on about a bitch.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Great. He could be anywhere. We're flat out of clues.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Hey, wait. Ted left a message. I could hear it 'cause I was in the bathroom... blowing my nose... I have the sniffles.

Speaker: Ted's voice:
Line: Hey, Lily, hope you're feeling better. Marshall told us you're exploding from both ends like a busted fire hydrant.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Damn it, Marshall.

Speaker: Ted's voice:
Line: Anyway, listen, I was going to get back together with Zoey today, but I came to my senses on the way out here, so... False alarm... Oh, crap. Just stepped in some gum. I'm getting back together with Zoey!

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Okay, we're never gonna find him.

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Wait, wait, wait. That's was a subway announcement in the background. I speak conductor.

Speaker: voice:
Line: Hey, Lily, hope you're feeling better. Marshall told us...

Speaker: Lily:
Line: Got it. Ted's at... (Lily runs to the bathroom and throws up) Oh... Ted's at Smith and Ninth Street.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: That's the intersection.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: That's in Brooklyn. How are we ever gonna get there in time?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Way ahead of ya.

Speaker: Ranjit:
Line: Hello!

Speaker: Man:
Line: Marshall. Jake Bloom. Great to meet you.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Hello, hi.

Speaker: Jake:
Line: Hey. Oh, I'm sorry about the stench. We're suing a factory that's been dumping raw sewage into a local marshland. Yeah, ten minutes ago, I was knee-deep in liquefied human feces. And that was just on the F train.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: I can't believe Ted's getting back together with Zoey.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: I know. They're a total train wreck.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Unmitigated disaster.

Speaker: Ranjit:
Line: Worst couple ever.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Yeah, almost as bad as us.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: We were a mess. Do you remember how awful I looked by the end? My hair was falling out, my skin was gray, my back was hunched.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: What about me? I got so fat, at the end of a date, you'd unhook my bra.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: You were the only boyfriend I ever motorboated.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Thank God we're not sentimental saps who panic and get back together. Seriously, why would people do that?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: I guess I get it.

Speaker: Barney:
Line: What do you mean?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Well, no matter how bad things got... Ted really did love Zoey for a minute there. Didn't he?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Yeah... he did. And... she loved him, too. Didn't she?

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Yeah, she did.

Speaker: Ranjit:
Line: Smith and Ninth Street.

Speaker: Jake:
Line: So, let me show you some of the gut-wrenching environmental atrocities that we were working to stop, okay? Here, pop quiz. What is that?

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: That's a seal.

Speaker: Jake:
Line: Bingo! Yes, a bloated seal corpse rotting in industrial waste.

Speaker: Marshall:
Line: Mm-hmm.

Speaker: Jake:
Line: Now, wait till you see what we found when we cut him open.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Okay, where the hell are they?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: Maybe this isn't the intersection.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Well, maybe it is and we're too late. Man, I wish we'd gone to Brooklyn sooner.

Speaker: Man:
Line: I know, right? Ever since the Trader Joe's opened up, Brooklyn is so... whatever.

Speaker: Robin:
Line: Wait. Where'd you get that? (The guy is holding a cup, on which is printed "The Intersection")

Speaker: Man:
Line: Across the street at the Intersection. So, uh, you guys... want to buy some weed or...?

Speaker: Barney:
Line: She's alone! There's still time! But where the hell is Ted?

Speaker: Robin:
